segments.speaker: SPEAKER_01
segments.text: Hi Vasilis, how are you doing? Hi Ben, how are you? Good, good, good to see you again. I think it's a case of, you know, where Vladimir felt you were kind of indexing against a couple of key requirements. So, you know, I don't think there's anything for you to be concerned about in terms of anything you did badly or maybe, you know, I think in some cases, potentially, your answers may have given a slightly different impression. Everything was by the book. I have nothing to complain.

segments.speaker: SPEAKER_01

segments.speaker: SPEAKER_01
segments.text: Well, I wouldn't go so far as to say that. I think there is some additional context to add here. As I explained to you previously, the staff data scientist role in the team is, firstly, it's the first staff data scientist in this team. And, secondly, it is also at the staff level. There's a high expectation. You know, we have a certain bar that we want people to hit, and, you know, it's actually pretty difficult to do that. So, you know, the pass rate for these interviews is not spectacularly high. And I don't necessarily think that's a sign of candidates doing a bad job. I think it's more that our expectations are high. And, actually, there's no negative feedback as such. Really, the main question mark is, is Vasilis measurably more experienced? Or, is she bringing something to the team that we don't already have today? And, you know, when we're looking to bring somebody in at staff level, and we're not promoting somebody into that role, of course, we need to consider that there needs to be almost that level of separation, if that makes sense.
